data.title: LETTER TO WILLIAM WEBSTER FROM JAMES MEASON

AVERELL HARRIMAN (1983-1986) HONORARY CHAIRMEN JOHN SHERMAN COOPER KENNETH RUSH CO-CHAIRMEN DAVID ABSHIRE WILLIAM J. VANDEN HEUVEL PRESIDENT WILLIAM MCC. BLAIR, JR. VICE CHAIRMEN ANGIER BIDDLE DUKE WILLIAM S. MAILLIARD FRANKLIN H. WILLIAMS MILTON A. WOLF VICE PRESIDENTS JOHN D.J. MOORE SALLY A. SHELTON-COLBY TREASURER HENRY L. KIMELMAN SECRETARY DAVID S. SMITH BOARD OF DIRECTORS WILLIAM MCC. BLAIR, JR. WALTER J.P. CURLEY PETER H. DAILEY SHELBY CULLOM DAVIS GUILFORD DUDLEY, JR. ANGIER BIDDLE DUKE JOSEPH S. FAALAND ALBERT FAY GEORGE J. FELDMAN RICHARD N. GARDNER JAMES DAY HODGSON JOHN G. HURD PHILIP M. KAISER HENRY L. KIMELMAN WILBERT J. LEMELLE WILLIAM S. MAILLIARD ANNE CLARK MARTINDELL GALE W. MCGEE GEORGE C. MCGHEE LLOYD I. MILLER JOHN D.J. MOORE ROBERT G. NEUMANN CHRISTOPHER H. PHILLIPS PAUL H. ROBINSON, JR. KENNETH RUSH NICOLAS M. SALGO SALLY A. SHELTON-COLBY DAVID S. SMITH JOAN E. SPEED WILLIAM J. VANDEN HEUVEL FRANKLIN H. WILLIAMS MILTON A. WoLF COUNSELOR DAVID D. NETVSOM EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR JAMES E. MEASON The Honorable William H. Webster Director of Central Intelligence Washington, D.C. 20505 Dear Director Webster: October 21, 1988 The Council of American Ambassadors extends you a warm invitation to inpa FaF -mweee ang -on ceme`?ls't & the 5tat ! -rtm The Council, a bi-partisan organization, is comprised of approximately 200 current former non-career U.S. Ambassadors. One of its many activities has been the sponsorship of eight highly successful international affairs oriented semi-annual meetings. Past participants have included, among others, Vice President Bush, Secretary Shultz, William Casey, William Colby, Dr. Zbigniew Brzezinski, Senators Lugar and Percy, Secretary-General Perez de Cuellar, Dr. Henry Kissinger, Caspar Weinberger, Admirals Crowe and Yost, General Vernon Walters, Dr. David Warnke, and Paul Nitze. I am enclosing, for your information, copies of our membersip list and Spring 1988 meeting program. Our program will concern two basic issues: the foreign policy transition (morning session) and aspects of Reagan Administration foreign and national security policy (afternoon session). Your experience and insight would prove to be a valuable addition to the afternoon session. Our programs are run on a non-attribution basis. am willing to discuss the nature of your participation at your earliest convenience. An individual address would be preferable, perhaps speaking to the role of the Intelligence Community in foreign policy formulation, the problems encountered with Congress in the intelligence area, and the impact of rapid technological innovation on intelligence gathering capabilities. A luncheon will be served for all participants, Council members, and guests in the Benjamin Franklin ballroom at State. The luncheon address will be given by Ambassador David Abshire, President of the Center for Strategic and International Studies, and concern the future of the Atlantic .Alliance. While the panelists for the transition program will, out of necessity, remain undetermined until after the election, a Declassified in Part - Sanitized Copy Approved for Release 2012/10/03: CIA-RDP90GO1353R001500180007-4 Declassified in Part - Sanitized Copy Approved for Release 2012/10/03: CIA-RDP90G01353RO01500180007-4 number of individuals have been invited to participate in the afternoon session. They include Secretary George Shultz, the Honorable William Taft, Lt. Gen. Colin Powell, the Honorable Robert McFarlane, and General Robert Herres. As you can see, quite a program has been planned. The Council would be honored by your acceptance of our invitation. I look forward to hearing from you soon. Respectfully yours, James E. Meason Executive Director Declassified in Part - Sanitized Copy Approved for Release 2012/10/03: CIA-RDP90G01353RO01500180007-4 y Declassified in Part - Sanitized Copy Approved for Release 2012/10/03: CIA-RDP90G01353RO01500180007-4 COlJNCIL OF AMERICAN AMASSADORS SPRING--1958- MEETING Department of State, Room 1105 April 21, 1988 8:15 Officers' Meeting & Building Passes 8:45-9:00 Registration 9:05-9:15 Opening Remarks The Honorable William McC. Blair, Jr. The Honorable William J. vanden Heuvel Morning Session: "Prospects for Middle East Negotiations' 9:15-9:45 Morning Keynote Address: Mr. Edward P. Djerejian Senior Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for Near Eastern and South Asian Affairs 10:00-11:30 Panel Discussion Moderator: The Honorable William J. vanden Heuvel Dr. Muhammad Hallaj Director, Palestine Research and Educational Center The Honorable Rita Hauser Partner, Stroock & Stroock & Lavan The Honorable Harold H. Saunders Former Assistant Secretary of State for Near Eastern and South Asian Affairs Dr. David Sidorsky Professor of Philosophy, Columbia University 11:45-12:00 "The Changing Nature of Multilateral Trade Diplomacy: GATT's Uruguay Round" The Honorable Michael A. Samuels United States Trade Representative to the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade 12:00-1:15 Luncheon Benjamin Franklin Room Luncheon Address: "The Run for the Presidency" Mr. Eddie Williams President, Joint Center for Political Studies Declassified in Part - Sanitized Copy Approved for Release 2012/10/03: CIA-RDP90G01353RO01500180007-4 Declassified in Part - Sanitized Copy Approved for Release 2012/10/03: CIA-RDP90G01353R001500180007-4 Afternoon Session: "The Foreign Policy Aspects of Drug Trafficking" 1:45-2:45 Afternoon Keynote Address: The Honorable Charles B. Rangel Chairman of the House of Representatives Select Committee on Narcotics Abuse and Control 3:00-4:30 Panel Discussion Moderator: The Honorable John A. Gavin The Honorable Mathea Falco Former Assistant Secretary of State for International Narcotics Matters The Honorable Michael Sotirhos U.S. Ambassador to Jamaica Mr. Jerrold Mark Dion Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for International Narcotics Matters Admiral Paul A.
